author: Staff Reporter
text:
The police on Sunday resorted to a lathi charge to disperse residents of Madikrishnapuram near Mullodai.

The residents blocked traffic on the Puducherry-Cuddalore Road and pelted stones at buses to press their long-pending demand for a crematorium.

According to police, the residents were returning after performing the last rites of one Allimuthu on the banks of the Thenpennaiyar River in Uchimedu in neighbouring Cuddalore district as Madikrishnapuram has no crematorium.

Verbal duel

A verbal duel broke out between residents of Madikrishnapuram and Uchimedu during bursting of crackers during the funeral.

The Cuddalore police rushed to the spot and chased away the two groups. The group of residents from Madikrishnapuram on returning to Mullodai blocked traffic on the Puducherry Cuddalore Road in support of their demand for a crematorium in the village itself.

Tension mounted after a section of them pelted stones on two buses passing through the area and a police patrol vehicle.

The protestors claimed that they could not go to Uchimedu every time and demanded the authorities to sanction a crematorium in the village immediately.

The police resorted to a lathicharge to disperse the agitators who refused to lift the blockade.

A senior police official said that the situation had been brought under control. A huge posse of police personnel have been stationed at Mullodai to prevent any untoward incident.

Residents have to go to Uchimedu in neighbouring Cuddalore district for cremation
title: Police lathi charge to disperse protesters
